briefdescription.para: Dart type.
Dart descriptor type.
Dart const descriptor type.

detaileddescription.para: When using indices, Dart_const_descriptor is equal to Dart_descriptor.

briefdescription.para: Information associated to each dart.
Size type (an unsigned integral type).
The tuple of cell attributes.

detaileddescription.para: It contains at most dimension+1 types (one for each possible cell of the generic map). Each type of the tuple must be either a model of the CellAttribute concept or void. The first type corresponds to 0-attributes, the second to 1-attributes and so on. If the i th type in the tuple is void, (i-1)-attributes are disabled. Otherwise, (i-1)-attributes are enabled and have the given type. If the size of the tuple is k, with k $ < $ dimension+1, $ \forall $ i: k $ \leq $ i $ \leq $ dimension, i-attributes are disabled.

briefdescription.para: Attribute_type<i>::type is the type of i-attributes, a model of CellAttribute concept.

detaileddescription.para:
Attribute_type<i>::type::Dart_descriptor is equal to Dart_descriptor, and Attribute_type<i>::type::Dart_const_descriptor is equal to Dart_const_descriptor.
0 $ \leq $ i $ \leq $ dimension and i-attributes are non void.
It can be implemented using a nested template class.

briefdescription.para: Attribute_descriptor<i>::type is a descriptor to i-attributes.

simplesect.para: 0 $ \leq $ i $ \leq $ dimension and i-attributes are non void.
It can be implemented using a nested template class.

briefdescription.para: Attribute_descriptor<i>::type is a const descriptor to i-attributes.

simplesect.para: 0 $ \leq $ i $ \leq $ dimension and i-attributes are non void.
It can be implemented using a nested template class.

briefdescription.para: Range of all the darts of the generic map.

detaileddescription.para: This type is a model of Range concept, its iterator type is bidirectional and its value type is Dart.

briefdescription.para: Const range of all the darts of the generic map.

detaileddescription.para: This type is a model of ConstRange concept, its iterator type is bidirectional and its value type is Dart.

briefdescription.para: Attribute_range<i>::type is the range of all the i-attributes.

detaileddescription.para:
Attribute_range<i>::type is a model of Range concept, its iterator type is bidirectional and its value type is Attribute_type<i>::type .
0 $ \leq $ i $ \leq $ dimension and i-attributes are non void.
It can be implemented using a nested template class.

briefdescription.para: Attribute_const_range<i>::type is the const range of all the i-attributes.

detaileddescription.para:
Attribute_const_range<i>::type is a model of ConstRange concept, its iterator type is bidirectional and its value type is Attribute_type<i>::type.
0 $ \leq $ i $ \leq $ dimension and i-attributes are non void.
It can be implemented using a nested template class.

briefdescription.para: Range of all the darts of the <I...> orbit.

detaileddescription.para: This type is a model of Range concept, its iterator type is forward and its value type is Dart.

briefdescription.para: Const range of all the darts of the <I...> orbit.

detaileddescription.para: This type is a model of ConstRange concept, its iterator type is forward and its value type is Dart.

briefdescription.para: Range of all the darts of an i-cell.

detaileddescription.para: Cells are considered in dim dimension, with 0 $ \leq $ i $ \leq $ dim+1 and 0 $ \leq $ dim $ \leq $ dimension. If i==dim+1, range of all the darts of a connected component. This type is a model of Range concept, its iterator type is forward and its value type is Dart.

briefdescription.para: Const range of all the darts of the i-cell.

detaileddescription.para: Cells are considered in dim dimension, with 0 $ \leq $ i $ \leq $ dim+1 and 0 $ \leq $ dim $ \leq $ dimension. If i==dim+1, range of all the darts of a connected component. This type is a model of ConstRange concept, its iterator type is forward and its value type is Dart.

briefdescription.para: Range of one dart of each i-cell incident to one j-cell.

detaileddescription.para: Cells are considered in dim dimension, with 0 $ \leq $ i $ \leq $ dim+1, 0 $ \leq $ j $ \leq $ dim+1 and 0 $ \leq $ dim $ \leq $ dimension. If i==dim+1, consider each connected component instead of each i-cell. If j==dim+1, consider one connected component instead of one j-cell. This type is a model of Range concept, its iterator type is forward and its value type is Dart.

briefdescription.para: Const range of one dart of each i-cell incident to one j-cell.

detaileddescription.para: Cells are considered in dim dimension, with 0 $ \leq $ i $ \leq $ dim+1, 0 $ \leq $ j $ \leq $ dim+1 and 0 $ \leq $ dim $ \leq $ dimension. If i==dim+1, consider each connected component instead of each i-cell. If j==dim+1, consider one connected component instead of one j-cell. This type is a model of ConstRange concept, its iterator type is forward and its value type is Dart.

briefdescription.para: Range of one dart of each i-cell of the generic map.

detaileddescription.para: Cells are considered in dim dimension, with 0 $ \leq $ i $ \leq $ dim+1 and 0 $ \leq $ dim $ \leq $ dimension. If i==dim+1, consider each connected component instead of each i-cell. This type is a model of Range concept, its iterator type is forward and its value type is Dart.

briefdescription.para: Const range of one dart of each i-cell of the generic map.

detaileddescription.para: Cells are considered in dim dimension, with 0 $ \leq $ i $ \leq $ dim+1 and 0 $ \leq $ dim $ \leq $ dimension. If i==dim+1, consider each connected component instead of each i-cell. This type is a model of ConstRange concept, its iterator type is forward and its value type is Dart.

briefdescription.para: The dimension d of the generic map.
The number of available Boolean marks of the generic map.
A null descriptor.

detaileddescription.para: This descriptor is not valid and should not be used to access a dart or an attribute.

briefdescription.para: Construct a new generic map from another one.

detaileddescription.para: The new generic map is created by copying the darts and the non void attributes of bmap. Map must be a model of GenericMap concept, which can be defined with a different dimension and/or different attributes than *this. In this case, only dimensions that are common to bmap and *this, and only non void i-attributes of bmap whose info type is the same to the info of non void i-attributes of *this, are copied.

briefdescription.para: Returns true iff the generic map is empty, i.e. it contains no dart.
Returns true iff the generic map is without i-boundary.

detaileddescription.para:
The map is without i-boundary if there is no i-free dart.
1 $ \leq $ i $ \leq $ dimension.

briefdescription.para: Returns true iff the generic map is without boundary in all dimensions.
Returns the number of darts in the generic map.
Returns the number of i-attributes in the generic map.

simplesect.para: 0 $ \leq $ i $ \leq $ dimension, and i-attributes are non void.

briefdescription.para: Returns an upper bound of the id of dart descriptors if indices are used or 0 otherwise.
Returns an upper bound of the id of i-attributes descriptors if indices are used or 0 otherwise.
Returns true if d is a descriptor of a used dart (i.e. valid).
Returns true iff dart d is i-free.
Returns true iff dart d is i-free.
Returns the highest dimension i such that dart d is not i-free.

detaileddescription.para: -1 if d is free for any dimension.

briefdescription.para: Returns a descriptor to a dart belonging to the other vertex of the edge containing dart d (but not necessarily to the same edge).

detaileddescription.para: null_descriptor if such a dart does not exist.

briefdescription.para: Returns a const descriptor to a dart belonging to the other vertex of the edge containing dart d, when the dart is const (but not necessarily to the same edge).

detaileddescription.para: null_descriptor if such a dart does not exist.

briefdescription.para: Returns a descriptor to a dart belonging to the next edge after d, that does not belong to the same 0-cell than d and that belongs to the same i-cell than dfor each i, 2 $ \leq $ i $ \leq $ dimension.

Returns a const descriptor to a dart belonging to the next edge after d, that does not belong to the same 0-cell than d and that belongs to the same i-cell than dfor each i, 2 $ \leq $ i $ \leq $ dimension.

Returns a descriptor to a dart belonging to the previous edge before d, that does not belong to the same 0-cell than d and that belongs to the same i-cell than dfor each i, 2 $ \leq $ i $ \leq $ dimension.

Returns a const descriptor to a dart belonging to the previous edge before d, that does not belong to the same 0-cell than d and that belongs to the same i-cell than dfor each i, 2 $ \leq $ i $ \leq $ dimension.
Returns a descriptor to a dart belonging to the opposite i-cell than d.

detaileddescription.para:
This dart does not belong to the same 0-cell than d, nor to the same i-cell, but belongs to the same i-cell than dfor each j, 2 $ \leq $ j $ \leq $ dimension, j $ \neq $ i.
2 $ \leq $ i $ \leq $ dimension.

briefdescription.para: Returns a const descriptor to a dart belonging to the opposite i-cell than d.

detaileddescription.para:
This dart does not belong to the same 0-cell than d, nor to the same i-cell, but belongs to the same i-cell than dfor each j, 2 $ \leq $ j $ \leq $ dimension, j $ \neq $ i.
2 $ \leq $ i $ \leq $ dimension.

briefdescription.para: Displays on os the number of elements of the generic map.

detaileddescription.para: Its number of darts, its number of i-cells, for each i, 0 $ \leq $ i $ \leq $ dimension, and its number of connected components.
Example of output for a 3D combinatorial map containing two disjoint combinatorial tetrahedra:

briefdescription.para: Returns the information associated to dart d.
Returns the information associated to dart d, when the dart is const.
Returns a descriptor to the i-attribute associated to dart d.

simplesect.para: 0 $ \leq $ i $ \leq $ dimension, and i-attributes are non void.

briefdescription.para: Returns a const descriptor to the i-attribute associated to dart d, when the dart is const.

simplesect.para: 0 $ \leq $ i $ \leq $ dimension, and i-attributes are non void.

briefdescription.para: Returns one dart of the cell associated to the i-attribute *ah.

detaileddescription.para:
nullptr if Supports_cell_dart of i-attributes is equal to Tag_false.
0 $ \leq $ i $ \leq $ dimension, i-attributes are non void and ah!=nullptr.

briefdescription.para: Returns one dart of the cell associated to the const i-attribute *ah.

detaileddescription.para:
nullptr if Supports_cell_dart of i-attributes is equal to Tag_false.
0 $ \leq $ i $ \leq $ dimension, i-attributes are non void and ah!=nullptr.

briefdescription.para: Returns the information of the i-attribute *ah.

detaileddescription.para:
Defined only if Info of i-attributes is not void.
0 $ \leq $ i $ \leq $ dimension, i-attributes are non void and ah!=nullptr.

briefdescription.para: Returns the information of the const i-attribute *ah.

detaileddescription.para:
Defined only if Info of i-attributes is not void.
0 $ \leq $ i $ \leq $ dimension, i-attributes are non void and ah!=nullptr.

briefdescription.para: A shortcut for info_of_attribute<i>(attribute<i>(adart)).
A shortcut for info_of_attribute<i>(attribute<i>(adart)) for const descriptor.
A shortcut for dart_of_attribute<i>(attribute<i>(adart)).
A shortcut for dart_of_attribute<i>(attribute<i>(adart)) for const descriptor.
Returns true if ah points to a used i-attribute (i.e. valid).

simplesect.para: 0 $ \leq $ i $ \leq $ dimension, and i-attributes are non void.

briefdescription.para: Returns the dart descriptors of d.
Returns the dart const descriptors of d.
Returns a range of all the darts in the generic map.
Returns a const range of all the darts in the generic map.
Returns a range of all the i-attributes in the generic map.

simplesect.para: 0 $ \leq $ i $ \leq $ dimension, and i-attributes are non void.

briefdescription.para: Returns a const range of all the i-attributes in the generic map.

simplesect.para: 0 $ \leq $ i $ \leq $ dimension, and i-attributes are non void.

briefdescription.para: Returns a range of all the darts of the orbit <I...>(d).

detaileddescription.para:
The first element in the range points onto d.
d $ \in $ darts() and I... is a sequence of integers $ i_1$, $ \ldots$, $ i_k$, such that 0 $ \leq $ $ i_1$ $ < $ $ i_2$ $ < $ $ \ldots$ $ < $ $ i_k$ $ \leq $ dimension.

briefdescription.para: Returns a const range of all the darts of the orbit <I...>(d).

detaileddescription.para:
The first element in the range points onto d.
Same as for the non const version.

briefdescription.para: Returns a range of all the darts of the i-cell containing d.

detaileddescription.para:
The first element in the range points onto d. i-cells are considered in dim dimension. If i==dim+1, range of all the darts of the connected component containing d.
d $ \in $ darts(), 0 $ \leq $ i $ \leq $ dim+1 and 0 $ \leq $ dim $ \leq $ dimension.

briefdescription.para: Returns a const range of all the darts of the i-cell containing d.

detaileddescription.para:
The first element in the range points onto d. i-cells are considered in dim dimension. If i==dim+1, const range of all the darts of the connected component containing d.
Same as for the non const version.

briefdescription.para: Returns a range of one dart of each i-cell incident to the j-cell containing d.

detaileddescription.para:
The first element in the range points onto d. Cells are considered in dim dimension. If i==dim+1, consider each connected component instead of each i-cell. If j==dim+1, consider the connected component containing d instead of the j-cell.
d $ \in $ darts(), 0 $ \leq $ i $ \leq $ dim+1, 0 $ \leq $ j $ \leq $ dim+1 and 0 $ \leq $ dim $ \leq $ dimension.

briefdescription.para: Returns a const range of one dart of each i-cell incident to the j-cell containing d.

detaileddescription.para:
The first element in the range points onto d. Cells are considered in dim dimension. If i==dim+1, consider each connected component instead of each i-cell. If j==dim+1, consider the connected component containing d instead of the j-cell.
Same as for the non const version.

briefdescription.para: Returns a range of one dart of each i-cell in the generic map.

detaileddescription.para:
Cells are considered in dim dimension. If i==dim+1, range of one dart of each connected component in the generic map.
0 $ \leq $ i $ \leq $ dim+1 and 0 $ \leq $ dim $ \leq $ dimension.

briefdescription.para: Returns a const range of one dart of each i-cell in the generic map.

detaileddescription.para:
Cells are considered in dim dimension. If i==dim+1, const range of one dart of each connected component in the generic map.
Same as for the non const version.

briefdescription.para: Creates a new dart in the generic map, and returns the corresponding descriptor.

detaileddescription.para: Calls the constructor of dart having T1 as parameter. A new dart is initialized to be i-free, $ \forall $ i: 0 $ \leq $ i $ \leq $ dimension, and to have no associated attribute for each non void attribute. Overloads of this member function are defined that take from zero to nine arguments. With zero argument, create_dart() creates a new dart by using the default constructor.

briefdescription.para: Removes d from the generic map.
Creates a new i-attribute in the generic map, and returns the corresponding descriptor.

detaileddescription.para:
Calls the constructor of i-attribute having T1 as parameter. Overloads of this member function are defined that take from zero to nine arguments. With zero argument, create_attribute<i>() creates a new i-attribute by using the default constructor.
0 $ \leq $ i $ \leq $ dimension, and i-attributes are non void.

briefdescription.para: Removes the i-attribute *ah from the generic map.

simplesect.para: 0 $ \leq $ i $ \leq $ dimension, i-attributes are non void, and *ah $ \in $ attributes<i>().

briefdescription.para: Associates the i-attribute of all the darts of the i-cell containing d to a.

simplesect.para: d $ \in $ darts(), 0 $ \leq $ i $ \leq $ dimension, i-attributes are non void, and *ah $ \in $ attributes<i>().

briefdescription.para: Deletes all the darts and all the attributes of the generic map.
Assignment operator.

detaileddescription.para: All darts and attributes are duplicated, and the former generic map is deleted.

briefdescription.para: Swap the current generic map with bmap.

detaileddescription.para: There is no copy of darts and attributes thus this method runs in constant time.

briefdescription.para: Returns the status of the management of the attributes of the generic map.

detaileddescription.para: true if the high level operations update the non void attributes (default value); false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Set the status of the management of the attributes of the generic map.

detaileddescription.para: After calling set_automatic_attributes_management(false), all high level operations will not update non void attributes, until the call of set_automatic_attributes_management(true). The call of set_automatic_attributes_management(true) call the correct_invalid_attributes() function.

briefdescription.para: Correct the invalid attributes of the generic map.

detaileddescription.para: We can have invalid attribute either if we have called set_automatic_attributes_management(false) before to use some modification operations or if we have modified the generic map by using low level operations.

memberdef.type: boost::function< void(typename Attribute_type< i >::type &, typename Attribute_type< i >::type &)> &
memberdef.definition: boost::function< void(typename Attribute_type< i >::type &, typename Attribute_type< i >::type &)> & GenericMap::onsplit_function
memberdef.name: onsplit_function

briefdescription.para: Return the current dynamic on-split function associated with i-attributes.

detaileddescription.para: This is a boost::function returning void and having two references to Attribute_type<i>::type as parameters. The on-split function is returned by reference so that we can modify it.

memberdef.type: const boost::function< void(typename Attribute_type< i >::type &, typename Attribute_type< i >::type &)> &
memberdef.definition: const boost::function< void(typename Attribute_type< i >::type &, typename Attribute_type< i >::type &)> & GenericMap::onsplit_function
memberdef.name: onsplit_function

briefdescription.para: Return the current dynamic on-split function associated with i-attributes, when *this is const.

detaileddescription.para: This is a boost::function returning void and having two references to Attribute_type<i>::type as parameters.

memberdef.type: boost::function< void(typename Attribute_type< i >::type &, typename Attribute_type< i >::type &)> &
memberdef.definition: boost::function< void(typename Attribute_type< i >::type &, typename Attribute_type< i >::type &)> & GenericMap::onmerge_function
memberdef.name: onmerge_function

briefdescription.para: Return the current dynamic on-merge function associated with i-attributes.

detaileddescription.para: This is a boost::function returning void and having two references to Attribute_type<i>::type as parameters. The on-merge function is returned by reference so that we can modify it.

memberdef.type: const boost::function< void(typename Attribute_type< i >::type &, typename Attribute_type< i >::type &)> &
memberdef.definition: const boost::function< void(typename Attribute_type< i >::type &, typename Attribute_type< i >::type &)> & GenericMap::onmerge_function
memberdef.name: onmerge_function

briefdescription.para: Return the current dynamic on-merge function associated with i-attributes, when *this is const.

detaileddescription.para: This is a boost::function returning void and having two references to Attribute_type<i>::type as parameters.

briefdescription.para: Reserves a new mark.

detaileddescription.para: Returns its index. If there is no more available free mark, throw the exception Exception_no_more_available_mark.

briefdescription.para: Returns true iff m is a reserved mark of the generic map.
Returns true iff dart d is marked for m.
Marks dart d for m.
Unmarks dart d for the mark m.
Inverse the mark m for all the darts of the generic map.

detaileddescription.para:
All the marked darts become unmarked and all the unmarked darts become marked.
is_reserved(m).

briefdescription.para: Unmarks all the darts of the generic map for m.
Returns the number of marked darts for m.
Return the number of unmarked darts for m.
Frees mark m.
Creates a combinatorial hexahedron (six combinatorial quadrangles 2-sewn together), and adds it in the generic map.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns a descriptor on one dart of this combinatorial hexahedron.
dimension $\geq$ 2.
make_edge()
make_combinatorial_polygon()
make_combinatorial_tetrahedron()

briefdescription.para: Creates a combinatorial polygon of length lg (a cycle of lg edges), and adds it in the generic map.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns a descriptor on one dart of this combinatorial polygon.
dimension $ \geq$ 1 and lg $ >$ 0.
make_edge()
make_combinatorial_tetrahedron()
make_combinatorial_hexahedron()

briefdescription.para: Creates a combinatorial tetrahedron (four combinatorial triangles 2-sewn together), and adds it in the generic map.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns a descriptor on one dart of this combinatorial tetrahedron.
dimension $ \geq$ 2.
make_edge()
make_combinatorial_polygon()
make_combinatorial_hexahedron()

briefdescription.para: Creates an isolated edge (two darts sewn to represent one edge and two vertices) and adds it in the generic map.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns a descriptor on one dart of this edge.
dimension $ \geq$ 2.
make_combinatorial_polygon()
make_combinatorial_tetrahedron()
make_combinatorial_hexahedron()

briefdescription.para: Inserts a 0-cell in the 1-cell containing d.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns next(d), a descriptor on one dart belonging to the new 0-cell.
dimension $ \geq$ 1 and d $ \in $ darts().
See examples for combinatorial map in fig__fig_cmap_insert_vertex and for generalized map in fig__fig_gmap_insert_vertex.

If are_attributes_automatically_managed()==true, if 1-attributes are non void, Attribute_type<1>::type::On_split(a,a') is called, with a the original 1-attribute associated with d and a' the new 1-attribute created during the operation. If set, the dynamic on-split function of 1-attributes is also called on a and a'.
If are_attributes_automatically_managed()==false, non void attributes are not updated; thus the generic map can be no more valid after this operation.

briefdescription.para: Inserts a 0-cell in the 2-cell containing d.

detaileddescription.para:
The 2-cell is split in triangles, one for each initial edge of the facet. Returns a descriptor on one dart belonging to the new 0-cell.
dimension $ \geq$ 2 and d $ \in $ darts().
See examples for combinatorial map in fig__fig_cmap_triangulation and for generalized map in fig__fig_gmap_triangulation.

If are_attributes_automatically_managed()==true, if 2-attributes are non void, Attribute_type<2>::type::On_split(a,a') is called, with a the original 2-attribute associated with d and a' each new 2-attribute created during the operation. If set, the dynamic on-split function of 2-attributes is also called on a and a'.
If are_attributes_automatically_managed()==false, non void attributes are not updated; thus the generic map can be no more valid after this operation.

briefdescription.para: Inserts a 1-cell in the 2-cell containing d1 and d2.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns previous(d1), a descriptor on one dart belonging to the new 1-cell.
is_insertable_cell_1_in_cell_2(d1,d2).
See examples for combinatorial map in fig__fig_cmap_insert_edge and for generalized map in fig__fig_gmap_insert_edge.

If are_attributes_automatically_managed()==true, if 2-attributes are non void, Attribute_type<2>::type::On_split(a,a') is called, with a the original 2-attribute associated with d1 and a' the new 2-attribute created during the operation. If set, the dynamic on-split function of 2-attributes is also called on a and a'.
If are_attributes_automatically_managed()==false, non void attributes are not updated; thus the generic map can be no more valid after this operation.

briefdescription.para: Inserts a 1-cell between the 2-cell containing d1 and the one containing d2.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns previous(d1), a descriptor on one dart belonging to the new 1-cell.
is_insertable_cell_1_between_two_cells_2(d1,d2).
If are_attributes_automatically_managed()==true, call Attribute_type<i>::type::On_merge(a,a') is called for all enabled i-attributes, for i>=2, with a the original 2-attribute associated with d1 and a' the original 2-attribute associated with d2. If set, the dynamic on-merge function of i-attributes is also called on a and a'.
If are_attributes_automatically_managed()==false, non void attributes are not updated; thus the generic map can be no more valid after this operation.

briefdescription.para: Call insert_cell_1_in_cell_2() if is_insertable_cell_1_in_cell_2(d1, d2), otherwise call insert_cell_1_between_two_cells_2().
Inserts a 2-cell along the path of 1-cells containing darts given by the range [afirst,alast).

detaileddescription.para:
Returns opposite<2>(*afirst), a descriptor on one dart belonging to the new 2-cell.
is_insertable_cell_2_in_cell_3(afirst,alast).
See examples for combinatorial map in fig__fig_cmap_insert_facet and for generalized map in fig__fig_gmap_insert_facet.

If are_attributes_automatically_managed()==true, if 3-attributes are non void, Attribute_type<3>::type::On_split(a,a') is called, with a the original 3-attribute associated with d and a' the new 3-attribute created during the operation. If set, the dynamic on-split function of 3-attributes is also called on a and a'.
If are_attributes_automatically_managed()==false, non void attributes are not updated; thus the generic map can be no more valid after this operation.

briefdescription.para: Inserts a 1-cell in a the 2-cell containing d, the 1-cell being attached only by one of its extremity to the 0-cell containing d.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns previous(d), a descriptor on the dart belonging to the new 1-cell and to the new 0-cell.
dimension $ \geq$ 2 and d $ \in $ darts().
See examples for combinatorial map in fig__fig_cmap_insert_edge and for generalized map in fig__fig_gmap_insert_edge.
If are_attributes_automatically_managed()==false, non void attributes are not updated; thus the generic map can be no more valid after this operation.

briefdescription.para: Returns true iff it is possible to insert a 1-cell in the generic map between d1 and d2.

detaileddescription.para:
This is possible if d1 $ \neq $ d2 and d1 can be reached from d2 by using some previous and next calls.
dimension $ \geq$ 2, d1 $ \in $ darts(), and d2 $ \in $ darts().
insert_cell_1_in_cell_2()
is_insertable_cell_2_in_cell_3<InputIterator>()

briefdescription.para: Returns true iff it is possible to insert a 1-cell in the generic map between d1 and d2.

detaileddescription.para:
This is possible if d1 $ \neq $ d2 and d1 can not be reached from d2 by using some previous and next calls.
dimension $ \geq$ 2, d1 $ \in $ darts(), and d2 $ \in $ darts().
insert_cell_1_between_two_cells_2()

briefdescription.para: Returns true iff it is possible to insert a 2-cell in the generic map along the path of darts given by the range [afirst,alast).

detaileddescription.para:
The 2-cell can be inserted iff the ordered list of darts form a closed path of edges inside a same volume.
dimension $ \geq$ 3.
insert_cell_2_in_cell_3<InputIterator>()
is_insertable_cell_1_in_cell_2()

briefdescription.para: Returns true iff the i-cell containing d can be removed.

detaileddescription.para:
An i-cell can be removed if i==dimension or if i==dimension-1 or if i $ < $ dimension-1 and the i-cell containing d is incident to at most two (i+1)-cells.
0 $ \leq $ i $ \leq $ dimension and d $ \in $ darts().
remove_cell<i>()

briefdescription.para: Removes the i-cell containing d.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns the number of darts removed from the generic map.
is_removable<i>(d).
See examples in fig__fig_cmap_insert_vertex, fig__fig_cmap_insert_edge and fig__fig_cmap_insert_facet.

If are_attributes_automatically_managed()==true, if i $ < $ dimension, and i+1-attributes are non void, and if there are two distinct (i+1)-cells around dart d, Attribute_type<i+1>::type::On_merge(a1,a2) is called, with a1 the (i+1)-attribute associated to d, and a2 the (i+1)-attribute associated to $ \beta_{i+1}$(d). If set, the dynamic on-merge function of i+1-attributes is also called on a1 and a2.

If are_attributes_automatically_managed()==true, if a j-cell is disconnected in two j-cells during the operation, and if j-attributes are non void, Attribute_type<j>::type::On_split(a,a') is called with a the original j-attribute and a' the new j-attribute created due to the disconnection. If set, the dynamic on-split function of j-attributes is also called on a and a'.
If are_attributes_automatically_managed()==false, non void attributes are not updated; thus the generic map can be no more valid after this operation.

briefdescription.para: The concept GenericMap defines a d-dimensional generic map. This concept is defined only to factorize the common notions between CombinatorialMap and GeneralizedMap concepts.

detaileddescription.para: A generic map has a set of darts D, and functions $ f_0$, $ \ldots$, $ f_{d}$ that link these darts between them.
